speaker: David
transcript: Look, Sarah, I can't approve this. It's out of the question.

speaker: Sarah
transcript: That's ridiculous, David. You *know* my team needs the Q4 funding for 'Project Phoenix'.

speaker: David
transcript: And *my* team needs to scale our platform. Your... 'Phoenix' is a vanity project.

speaker: Sarah
transcript: A vanity project? It's the only thing innovative this company has done in years. Unlike your... 'scaling'.

speaker: David
transcript: This is pointless. We're getting nowhere.

speaker: Sarah
transcript: Fine. I'll just have to... go around you. I'm sure *Mark* will see the value in my project.

speaker: David
transcript: (laughs) Good luck with that. Mark only cares about Mark. He'll gut your project for parts.

speaker: Sarah
transcript: We'll see. (pause) Is... the draft budget finalized for tomorrow's 10 AM?

speaker: David
transcript: It is. And the... *revised* numbers are exactly where they need to be.

speaker: Sarah
transcript: Good. Then I guess... we're done here.

speaker: David
transcript: We are. Don't let the door hit you on the way out.
